company_description: Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background. Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
position_description: As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients' data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. You will work with state-of-the-art open source and proprietary tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment approaches. You will work to solve clients' business problems.
favored_schools: Stanford, UC Berkeley, MIT, Georgia Institute of Technology, KAIST, HKUST, Waterloo
favored_majors: Computer Science, Data Science, Industrial engineering, Statistics
responsibilities_description: Implement solutions with engineering best practices to reflect architectural and design decisions that have been made in terms of functionality, user experience, performance, reliability, and scalability. Devise and utilize algorithms and models for mining big data stores, performing data and error analysis to improve models, and clean and validate data for uniformity and accuracy. Design and implement software components using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and design consequences. Working with client, both business side and data scientist group to developing or enhancing ML model for marketing performance.

company_description: At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us. Boeing places high priority in identifying the right talent for its workforce, and in investing in its employees’ careers and development. Boeing begins its employees’ journey with a two-year fixed-term employment contract with full benefits. Following successful completion of the employment term, employees will be eligible to permanently continue their employment.
position_description: The Boeing Korea Engineering and Technology Center is seeking a high-potential Senior Software Engineer to join Boeing Research & Technology (BR&T) team based in ASEM Tower, Samsung-Dong, Seoul. We develop the platform, algorithm, Linux based custom OS for Health Management of our products and work in a hybrid manner (combination of work from home and office).
favored_majors: Computer Science, Industrial engineering, Mathematics, Physics
favored_experience_keywords: OS, I/O drivers, Networking, SDLC, DO-178, ISO, Avionics, flight, agile, Git
responsibilities_description:
Develop edge application for analysis and processing of ARINC-664 based Ethernet Data packet to transfer to cloud-based application.
A successful candidate will lead a diverse group of junior-level through senior-level embedded software engineers to develop innovative mission airline health management software/platform in a collaborative and fast-paced environment.
All software engineering lifecycle activities in line with DO-178 Aircraft Airworthiness Certification including planning, requirements development, software architecture design, software development, and verification for the Boeing products.
The candidate will oversee teams in various phases of maturity, spanning from project inception through operational sustainment for both program-unique and product-line projects.
